description: A 2D greenhouse simulator game where players maintain optimal conditions for growing tomato plants, demonstrating the complexity of real-world crop management

tasks.title: Initialize Godot Project Structure
tasks.description: As a developer, I need the basic Godot 4.x project structure set up so we can start building the game.
acceptanceCriteria: project.godot file configured with correct settings
Directory structure created (scenes/, scripts/, prefabs/, assets/, tests/)
Main scene (main.tscn) created and set as default
Basic window settings configured (1152x648 resolution, canvas_items stretch)
Project runs without errors in Godot editor

tasks.title: Create Simulation Core Singleton
tasks.description: As a player, I need a simulation engine that tracks temperature and humidity so environmental conditions can be monitored and modified.
acceptanceCriteria: simulation_core.gd created as an Autoload singleton
Temperature tracking with getter/setter (float, Celsius)
Humidity tracking with getter/setter (float, percentage 0-100)
Signals emitted when values change: temperature_changed, humidity_changed
Time-based decay system for natural condition drift
Unit tests for core simulation logic (test_simulation_core.gd)

tasks.title: Build Environment Stats UI
tasks.description: As a player, I need to see current temperature and humidity on screen so I can make informed decisions about equipment usage.
acceptanceCriteria: UI scene created (environment_ui.tscn)
Temperature display with clear visual indicator
Humidity display with clear visual indicator
Real-time updates when simulation values change
UI positioned clearly on screen (top corner or sidebar)
Visual feedback when values are outside optimal ranges

tasks.title: Implement Equipment Base System
tasks.description: As a developer, I need a base equipment class so all greenhouse equipment follows a consistent interface.
acceptanceCriteria: EquipmentBase class created in scripts/equipment_base.gd
Properties: energy_cost (float), active (bool)
Methods: activate(), deactivate(), can_activate(), _on_activate(), _on_deactivate()
Equipment can only activate if can_activate() returns true
Signal emitted when equipment state changes
Unit tests for equipment base functionality

tasks.title: Create Heat Pump Equipment
tasks.description: As a player, I need a heat pump to increase greenhouse temperature when it gets too cold for the plants.
acceptanceCriteria: HeatPump class extends EquipmentBase
Increases temperature when active (configurable rate)
Has visual indicator (sprite/icon) in game
Clickable/toggleable UI control
Consumes energy when active
Unit tests for temperature increase logic

tasks.title: Create Fan Equipment
tasks.description: As a player, I need a fan to decrease temperature and humidity when conditions get too hot or moist.
acceptanceCriteria: Fan class extends EquipmentBase
Decreases temperature when active (configurable rate)
Decreases humidity when active (configurable rate)
Visual indicator and clickable UI control
Consumes energy when active
Unit tests for dual effect (temp + humidity reduction)

tasks.title: Create Vent Equipment
tasks.description: As a player, I need a vent to decrease temperature, humidity, and CO2 levels.
acceptanceCriteria: Vent class extends EquipmentBase
Decreases temperature, humidity, and CO2 when active
Visual indicator and clickable UI control
Consumes energy when active
Unit tests for multi-stat reduction logic

tasks.title: Create Irrigation Equipment
tasks.description: As a player, I need irrigation to increase humidity and provide water to plants.
acceptanceCriteria: Irrigation class extends EquipmentBase
Increases humidity when active (configurable rate)
Provides water resource for plant growth
Visual indicator and clickable UI control
Consumes energy when active
Unit tests for humidity increase and water provision

tasks.title: Create Greenhouse Tilemap
tasks.description: As a player, I need a visual greenhouse environment with ground, walls, and benches so the game world is recognizable.
acceptanceCriteria: Tilemap scene created with ground layer
Greenhouse walls and structure visible
Plant benches/beds positioned for crops
Y-sorting configured for proper depth rendering
Basic placeholder art (can be improved later)
Scene loads correctly in main.tscn

tasks.title: Implement Tomato Plant Growth
tasks.description: As a player, I want to grow a tomato plant through multiple stages so there's a goal to achieve.
acceptanceCriteria: TomatoPlant class created with growth stages enum
Growth stages: Seedling, Vegetative, Flowering, Fruiting, Harvest
Each stage has optimal temperature/humidity ranges
Growth rate affected by environmental conditions
Plant health system (can die if conditions are poor)
Visual representation of each growth stage
Unit tests for growth logic and stage transitions

tasks.title: Add Win/Lose Conditions
tasks.description: As a player, I need clear win and lose conditions so I know when I've succeeded or failed.
acceptanceCriteria: Win condition: Tomato reaches harvest stage
Lose condition: Tomato plant dies (health reaches 0)
Win/Lose screen or modal displayed
Option to restart game after win/lose
Game state tracking (playing, won, lost)
Unit tests for win/lose detection

tasks.title: Create Equipment Control Panel UI
tasks.description: As a player, I need a control panel to toggle equipment on/off so I can manage the greenhouse.
acceptanceCriteria: Control panel UI scene with all equipment buttons
Each equipment has on/off toggle button
Visual feedback showing active/inactive state
Energy consumption display
Clicking button activates/deactivates equipment
Responsive layout that works on web export

tasks.title: Configure Web Export
tasks.description: As a developer, I need the game configured for web export so it can be easily shared and played in browsers.
acceptanceCriteria: Export template configured for Web platform
export_presets.cfg created with web settings
Game exports successfully to HTML5
All scenes and resources included in export
Tested in browser (Chrome/Firefox)
Responsive scaling for different screen sizes

tasks.title: Add Sound Effects and Polish
tasks.description: As a player, I want sound effects and visual polish so the game feels complete and engaging.
acceptanceCriteria: Equipment activation sound effects
Background ambient sound (greenhouse atmosphere)
UI button click sounds
Win/lose jingles
Smooth animations for equipment state changes
Particle effects for equipment (steam, water, etc.)
